_header.author: R. A. Carucci
_header.purpose: Comprehensive NIBRS offense classification lookup with NCIC mappings, crime types, and validation data for arrest analytics

09A.definition: The willful (nonnegligent) killing of one human being by another.
includes: Deaths from fights, arguments, quarrels, assaults
excludes: Heart attacks during crimes (not direct injury)
09A.reporting_notes: Report circumstances in Data Element 31 (Aggravated Assault/Homicide Circumstances). Court findings should NOT influence reporting.

09B.definition: The killing of another person through gross negligence.
excludes: Deaths due to victim's own negligence
Accidental deaths not from gross negligence
09B.reporting_notes: Firearm-related uses Data Values 30-33 in DE31. Other negligent killings use Data Value 34.

09C.definition: The killing of a perpetrator of a serious criminal offense by a law enforcement officer in the line of duty, OR a private individual during the commission of a serious criminal offense.
includes: Private citizen defense during serious crimes
09C.reporting_notes: ALWAYS requires multiple incidents: (1) underlying serious offense, (2) justifiable homicide, (3) any offense by justified killer. Report additional circumstances in Data Element 32.

100.definition: The unlawful seizure, transportation, and/or detention of a person against his/her will or of a minor without the consent of his/her custodial parent(s) or legal guardian.
100.reporting_notes: ONLY Crime Against Person offense requiring property reporting. Use property segment for ransom. If no ransom, DE14 = 1 (None). Report ONLY kidnapped persons as victims, NOT ransom payers.

11A.definition: The penetration, no matter how slight, of the vagina or anus with any body part or object, or oral penetration by a sex organ of another person, without the consent of the victim. Includes rape of both males and females.
11A.reporting_notes: Starting 2023: 11B (Sodomy) and 11C (Sexual Assault with Object) recode to 11A. Starting 2025: 11B and 11C will be rejected.

11D.definition: The touching of the private body parts of another person for the purpose of sexual gratification, without the consent of the victim, including instances where the victim is incapable of giving consent because of his/her age or because of his/her temporary or permanent mental incapacity.
includes: Touching of victims unable to consent due to age
Touching of victims unable to consent due to mental incapacity

120.definition: The taking or attempting to take anything of value from the care, custody, or control of a person or persons by force or threat of force or violence and/or by putting the victim in fear.
120.reporting_notes: Report as Robbery only; do NOT add assault (integral element). If sexual assault during robbery, report BOTH. Carjacking = Robbery (NOT Motor Vehicle Theft).
120.carjacking_note: Report carjacking as 120 only, NOT as 240

13A.definition: An unlawful attack by one person upon another wherein the offender uses a dangerous weapon or displays it in a threatening manner, OR the victim suffers obvious severe or aggravated bodily injury, OR where there was a risk for serious injury/intent to seriously injure.
key_elements: dangerous weapon OR severe injury OR intent to seriously injure
includes: Use of firearms, knives, blunt objects
13A.reporting_notes: Data Element 7 must ALWAYS be C = Completed (no attempted assaults by definition). Report circumstances in DE31.

13B.definition: An unlawful physical attack by one person upon another where neither the offender displays a dangerous weapon, nor the victim suffers obvious severe or aggravated bodily injury involving apparent broken bones, loss of teeth, possible internal injury, severe laceration, or loss of consciousness.
13B.reporting_notes: Data Element 7 must ALWAYS be C = Completed (no attempted assaults by definition).

13C.definition: To unlawfully place another person in reasonable fear of harm through the use of threatening words and/or other conduct without displaying a dangerous weapon or subjecting the victim to an actual physical attack.
13C.reporting_notes: Data Element 7 must ALWAYS be C = Completed (no attempted assaults by definition).

200.definition: To unlawfully and intentionally damage or attempt to damage any real or personal property by fire or incendiary device.
includes: Determined through investigation to be intentionally set
200.reporting_notes: Report ONLY fires determined to be unlawfully/intentionally set. LEA where fire started reports all damage. Property value includes incidental fire-fighting damage. Exclude deaths/injuries of police/firefighters unless willful murder/assault.

210.definition: To unlawfully obtain money, property, or any other thing of value, either tangible or intangible, through the use or threat of force, misuse of authority, threat of criminal prosecution, threat of destruction of reputation or social standing, or through other coercive means.
210.reporting_notes: Differs from Robbery: non-confrontational, victim NOT in immediate fear. If intangible benefit, use property code 66 (Identity-Intangible) or 77 (Other).

220.definition: The unlawful entry into a building or some other structure to commit a felony or a theft.
key_elements: intent to commit felony or theft
includes: Structures with four walls, roof, and door
House trailers used as permanent dwellings
excludes: Motor homes used for recreation (report as larceny)
220.reporting_notes: Trespass is essential. Larceny is element of burglary (do NOT report separate larceny). Apply Hotel Rule for multi-unit properties. Report substantial incidental damage separately as 290.

23A.definition: The theft of articles from another person's physical possession by stealth where the victim is not immediately aware a theft occurred.
23A.reporting_notes: If force beyond jostling used, classify as Strong-Arm Robbery.

23B.definition: The grabbing or snatching of a purse, handbag, etc., from the physical possession of another person.
excludes: Unattended purses (classify as appropriate theft category)
23B.reporting_notes: Item must be on victim's person. If force used or victim resists, classify as Strong-Arm Robbery.

23C.definition: The unlawful taking of goods or merchandise exposed for sale by a person (other than an employee).
includes: Merchandise outside as part of stock
excludes: Employee theft (report as Embezzlement or other)
23C.reporting_notes: Assumes offender had legal access (no trespass/unlawful entry).

23D.definition: The unlawful taking of items from within a building which is either open to the general public or to which the offender has legal access.
key_elements: legal access OR open to public
includes: Guest theft from homes during legal visit
23D.reporting_notes: If illegal entry, report as 220 = Burglary.

23E.offense_name: Theft From Coin-Operated Machine or Device
23E.definition: The unlawful taking of items from a machine or device that is operated or activated by the use of coins.
23E.reporting_notes: If breaking or illegal entry of building, report as 220 = Burglary.

23F.definition: The unlawful taking of articles from a motor vehicle, locked or unlocked.
23F.reporting_notes: If both articles AND parts stolen, report BOTH 23F and 23G. With motor vehicle theft, usually report 240 only unless contents were real object.

23G.offense_name: Theft of Motor Vehicle Parts or Accessories
23G.definition: The unlawful taking of any part or accessory affixed to the interior or exterior of a motor vehicle in a manner which would make the item an attachment of the vehicle or necessary for its operation.

23H.definition: All thefts which do not fit any of the specific Larceny/Theft subcategories.
key_elements: does not fit other larceny categories
23H.reporting_notes: Gasoline from self-service = 23H (no contract). Gasoline from full-service = 26A (tacit agreement).

240.definition: The theft of a motor vehicle.
240.reporting_notes: Carjacking = 120 only (NOT 240). Burglary + MV theft from garage may require BOTH 220 and 240 if separate operations.

250.definition: The altering, copying, or imitating of something, without authority or right, with the intent to deceive or defraud by passing the copy or thing altered or imitated as that which is original or genuine, OR the selling, buying, or possession of an altered, copied, or imitated thing with the intent to deceive or defraud.
250.reporting_notes: When forged instrument used to obtain items, report TWO offenses: (1) 250 = Counterfeiting/Forgery, (2) 26A = False Pretenses. Type Property Loss for completed = 3 (Counterfeited/Forged), 5 (Recovered), or 6 (Seized).

26A.definition: The intentional misrepresentation of existing fact or condition or the use of some other deceptive scheme or device to obtain money, goods, or other things of value.
26A.reporting_notes: Only for fraud offenses not fitting specific subcategories. Bailee conversion (rent and keep) = 26A.

26B.definition: The unlawful use of a credit/debit card, credit/debit card number, or automatic teller machine for fraudulent purposes.
26B.reporting_notes: Applies to USE of card/number, not theft of card itself.

26C.definition: Unlawfully representing one's position and acting in the character or position to deceive others and thereby gain a profit or advantage, or enjoy some right or privilege.
excludes: Fraudulent use of credit card number (26B)

26D.definition: The use of deceitful statements, practices, or devices to unlawfully obtain welfare benefits.

26E.definition: The use of an electric or electronic communications facility to intentionally transmit a false and/or deceptive message in furtherance of a fraudulent activity.

26F.definition: Wrongfully obtaining and/or using another person's personal data (e.g., name and date of birth, Social Security number, driver's license number).
includes: Opening credit cards with stolen data
Opening bank accounts with stolen data

26G.definition: Gaining access to another person's or institution's computer software, hardware, or networks without authorized permissions.

26H.definition: The process of transforming the profits of a crime into a legitimate asset.

270.definition: The unlawful misappropriation by an offender to his/her own use or purpose of money, property, or some other thing of value entrusted to his/her care, custody, or control.
270.reporting_notes: Requires employer/employee OR legal agent relationship. Property must be entrusted.

280.definition: Buying, receiving, possessing, selling, concealing, or transporting any property with the knowledge that it has been unlawfully taken.
280.reporting_notes: Offender KNEW or had reason to believe property was stolen.

290.definition: To willfully or maliciously destroy, damage, deface, or otherwise injure any public or private property without the consent of the owner or the person having custody or control of it.
290.reporting_notes: Report ONLY if substantial damage occurred. Determination left to LEA discretion. Arson includes incidental fire-fighting damage.

35A.definition: The unlawful cultivation, manufacture, distribution, sale, purchase, use, possession, transportation, or importation of any controlled substance.
35A.reporting_notes: Do NOT enter value in DE16. Report DE20 (Suspected Drug Type), DE21 (Estimated Drug Quantity), DE22 (Type Drug Measurement).

35B.definition: The unlawful manufacture, sale, purchase, possession, or transportation of equipment or devices utilized in preparing and/or using drugs or narcotics.

36A.definition: Sexual intercourse between persons who are related to each other within the degrees wherein marriage is prohibited by law.

36B.definition: Sexual intercourse with a person who is under the statutory age of consent.

360.offense_name: Failure to Register as a Sex Offender
360.definition: Failure to comply with sex offender registration requirements.

370.definition: The violation of laws or ordinances prohibiting the manufacture, publishing, sale, purchase, or possession of sexually explicit material.

39A.definition: To unlawfully stake money or something else of value on the happening of an uncertain event or on the ascertainment of a fact in dispute.
39A.reporting_notes: In areas where gambling is legal, report ONLY violations of local statutes.

39B.definition: To unlawfully operate, promote, or assist in the operation of a game of chance, lottery, or other gambling activity.

39C.definition: To unlawfully manufacture, sell, buy, possess, or transport equipment, devices, and/or goods used for gambling purposes.
39C.reporting_notes: Report type of activity in DE12.

39D.definition: To unlawfully alter, meddle in, or otherwise interfere with a sporting contest or event for the purpose of gaining a gambling advantage.

40A.definition: To unlawfully engage in or promote sexual activity for profit.

40B.definition: To unlawfully assist or promote prostitution activities.

40C.definition: To unlawfully purchase sexual activity for profit.

510.definition: The offering, giving, receiving, or soliciting anything of value (e.g., a bribe, gratuity, or kickback) to sway the judgement or action of a person in a position of trust or influence.

520.definition: The violation of laws or ordinances prohibiting the manufacture, sale, purchase, transportation, possession, concealment, or use of firearms, cutting instruments, explosives, incendiary devices, or other deadly weapons.

521.offense_name: Violation of National Firearm Act of 1934
521.definition: Violations of federal firearm regulations under the National Firearm Act of 1934.

522.definition: Offenses involving weapons of mass destruction.

64A.definition: Inducing a person by force, fraud, or coercion to participate in commercial sex acts, OR in which the person induced to perform such act(s) has not attained 18 years of age.
includes: All juveniles induced to commercial sex
64A.reporting_notes: All juveniles considered victims. Involves exploitation.

64B.definition: The obtaining of person(s) through recruitment, harboring, transportation, or provision, and subjecting such persons by force, fraud, or coercion into involuntary servitude, peonage, debt bondage, or slavery (not to include commercial sex acts).

720.definition: Intentionally, knowingly, or recklessly taking an action that mistreats or kills any animal without just cause, such as torturing, tormenting, mutilation, maiming, poisoning, or abandonment.
720.reporting_notes: Report type of activity in DE12: simple/gross neglect, organized abuse, intentional abuse/torture, animal sexual abuse.

30A.offense_name: Illegal Entry into the United States
30A.definition: To attempt to enter the U.S. at any time or place other than as designated; or eludes examination/inspection by immigration officers.

30B.definition: Falsely and willfully representing oneself to be a citizen of the United States.

30C.definition: To knowingly assist, abet, or aid another person to enter, or try to enter, the United States illegally.

30D.definition: The act of entering, attempting to enter, or being found in the United States after being removed, excluded, deported, or has departed the United States while an order of removal exclusion or deportation is outstanding.

49A.definition: To harbor or conceal any person for whose arrest, a warrant or process has been issued, so as to prevent the fugitive's discovery and arrest, after having notice or knowledge that a warrant or process has been issued for the fugitive's apprehension.

49B.definition: To knowingly leave the jurisdiction where charges were filed with intent to avoid prosecution, custody, confinement, or to avoid giving testimony in any criminal proceedings.

49C.definition: To knowingly leave the jurisdiction with intent to avoid deportation.

58A.definition: To knowingly or willfully defraud the United States by smuggling, importing, or clandestinely introducing merchandise that should have been invoiced, received, bought, sold, or facilitate the transportation, the concealment, or sale of such merchandise after importation.

58B.definition: To knowingly or willfully defraud the United States by smuggling, exporting, or clandestinely distributing merchandise that should have been invoiced, received, bought, sold, or facilitate the transportation, the concealment, or sale of such merchandise after exportation.

61A.definition: The unlawful production (using an unregistered still), transportation (without proper bill of lading), receipt, distribution, or smuggling of distilled spirits on which federal tax has not been paid. Acting as a distiller, a winery, or a wholesaler of distilled spirits, wine, or malt beverages without a federal permit.

61B.definition: The unlawful possession and/or distribution of contraband tobacco products; including any quantity of cigarettes in excess of 10,000 or other tobacco products if the cigarettes/products bear no evidence of the payment of applicable state taxes in the state where the cigarettes are found. Engaging in interstate commerce in tobacco products without registering with, and reporting to, the federal government and applicable state tax administrators.

101.definition: Violation of allegiance toward one's country; betrayal of one's country.

103.definition: The act of obtaining, delivering, transmitting, communicating, or receiving national security or national defense information with an intent, or reason to believe, that the information may be used to the injury of the United States or to the advantage of any foreign nation.

620.definition: The poaching or other illegal taking of protected or managed species and the illegal trade in wildlife and their related parts and products.

90B.definition: Violations of curfew, loitering, or vagrancy ordinances.

90C.definition: Unlawful interruption of peace, quiet, or order of a community.

90D.definition: Driving or operating any vehicle or common carrier while drunk or under the influence of liquor or drugs.
90D.reporting_notes: Report only when arrest made. DUI-related fatalities = 09B (Negligent Manslaughter).

90F.definition: Unlawful nonviolent acts by a family member (or legal guardian) that threaten the physical, mental, or economic well-being or morals of another family member and that are not classifiable as other offenses.
90F.reporting_notes: Report only when arrest made. Violent family offenses = appropriate Group A offense.

90G.definition: State or local liquor law violations, except drunkenness and driving under the influence.
90G.reporting_notes: Report only when arrest made. Federal liquor offenses = 61A.

90J.definition: To unlawfully enter land, a dwelling, or other real property.
90J.reporting_notes: Report only when arrest made. Trespass with intent to commit felony/theft = 220 (Burglary).

90K.definition: Failure to appear as required by bond conditions.
90K.reporting_notes: Report only when arrest made. Federal and tribal LEAs only.

90L.definition: Violations of federal resource protection laws.
90L.reporting_notes: Report only when arrest made. Federal and tribal LEAs only.

90M.reporting_notes: Report only when arrest made. Federal and tribal LEAs only.

90Z.definition: All violations of state or local laws not specifically identified as Group A or Group B offenses, except traffic violations.
90Z.reporting_notes: Report only when arrest made. Includes Offenses of General Applicability when substantive offense is Group A (conspiracy, accessory, aiding/abetting, etc.). Excludes traffic offenses except DUI, hit-and-run, vehicular manslaughter.
